oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Question and answer session - Vince Gill - 2001-mm-dd / John Paul Daniel song demos.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Question and answer session with Vince Gill which Vince calls 20 questions with Vince and Larry. Gill reads questions and then answers them. Date not listed on tape but reference is made to the 2001 CMA Fan Fair. 2001-mm-dd. Recorded over what appears to be fully produced song demonstrations recordings by songwriter John Paul Daniel with other co-writers.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Vince Gill; John Paul Daniel; Jon Davis;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Mic check and general comments / (01:35) Answers question about his participation in Fan Fair 2001 / (2:07) Addendum to question 1 / (02:53) What is the most memorable work that he's done and talks about his career to date / (04:49) His favorite singer's voice / (06:07) His process for writing songs / (7:38) Being fair being the most important thing his father taught him growing up / (08:56) Wanting to record the song Old Shep / (09:55) Three albums that he would want with him on a desert island / (11:09) Guitar influences / (12:22) Talks about benefiting other people and the scholarships at Belmont University / (14:00) Talks about hard songs to sing and the hardest song he sings / (16:05) Favorite venues to perform in and why / (18:00) Aborted question / (18:55) Aborted question / (19:20) Talks about the future of country music and the future of the Grand Ole Opry / (22:04) His dream band / (23:50) Were does he see himself in the future /

(24:18) Asked if his parenting style will change from first child to his next / (25:33) His favorite song of his wife Amy Grant / (27:09) Coming up with baby names / (28:00) What's the strangest place that he's heard that his records have been played / (29:45) Deciding which songs to performs in concert / (31:10) Talks about his future production work and working with Sonya Isaacs / END OF INTERVIEW SEGMENT WITH VINCE GILL / JOHN PAUL DANIEL SONG DEMOS / (32:38) Can't Get Enough (begins in progress) (SD) (JPD/Herrington) / (35:38) Was It Something He Said (SD) (JPD/Herrington) / (39:20) He Went to Heaven, She Went To Jamaica (W?) / (44:23) It Was For Me (SD) (JPD/Monty Powell/ R. Crosby) / (48:11) Listen To Me (SD-female) (JPD/BT/D. Cochran) / (51:45) Nothin' Short Of A Miracle (begins in progress) (SD-female) (JPD/Del Ray) / (55:15) Nothin' Short Of A Miracle (SD-male) (JPD/Del Ray) / (59:00) Your Love Comforts Me (GWT) (JPD/Jon Davis) /
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:isPartOf: Container insert has John Paul Daniel -Safety (SC) JPD-11 written in ink, along with song titles, writer and personnel.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Gill, Vince; Daniel, John Paul; Davis, Jon; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
